RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 2, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since June 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COMIDA COMIDA exchanged light contact with Soul Of The Beast leaving the gate then engaged in close chase, contested even terms three wide on the turn, dueled for the lead mid-stretch and edged away late yards. CRUZ IN THE CASTLE contested a pressured pace inside, raced at even terms at the rail on the turn and dueled close through the upper stretch, was outfinished later yards but held on for second. CAJUN COUSIN gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn, eased out entering the stretch and finished well to take third late yards. LIKELY CHOICE chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and finished evenly to pass rivals. SUPER WILDCAT contested a pressured pace two deep, dueled between horses through the turn but dropped back past the eighth pole and flattened from mid-stretch. BESTLA chased outside, rounded the turn in the five path then flattened in the lane. ULTIMATE BREEZE gave chase, raced in the six path on the turn and flattened in the lane. SOUL OF THE BEAST exchanged light contact with Comida Comida leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Cruz in the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace inside,even terms rail turn,outfinished late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Likely Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Wasabi Ventures Stables LLC & Greenspring Mares LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUNAWAY ROAD ducked in and made contact with Sky Of Gold leaving the gate then took the lead at the half mile pole and rated the pace, contested the advantage at the rail on the turn and dug in under steady handling to hold on. CAJUN FUN ducked in and made contact with Big Balloons leaving the gate then gave chase through the backstretch, raced close in the four path on the turn and dug in gamely to the wire. WOOTDAREITIS rated close inside, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. HELL'S KITTEN engaged in close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path then flattened in the lane. GLORIOUS MAHOMES came away awkwardly and exchanged contact with Baby Quinn then gave chase, rounded the turn at the rail and showed little more. BIG BALLOONS was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, eased outward through the turn, left the turn about the six path and flattened stride. BABY QUINN exchanged contact with Glorious Mahomes leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and raced in the six path on the turn, then weakened. SKY OF GOLD chased through the backstretch, raced in the three and four paths on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Fun
ENTRY.OWNER: Holly Ridge Farm, LLC and Collins, Timothy
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped break,chased,4p turn,gamely to wire

ENTRY.NAME: Runaway Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped break,up 1/2,rated pace,rail turn,held on drving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 12300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MUD BUG was bumped leaving the gate then settled off the pace about the three path, started a bid leaving the half mile pole and took over two deep at the quarter, raced clear midway on the far turn and was steadily urged to hold on. HE'S ON FIRE rounded the first turn in the five path, started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn then dueled through the stretch and finished well to take second. DAD'S LIL SPARK rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met at the quarter, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. AKINGISALWAYSKING rated close inside for a half mile, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole then angled to the five path approaching the far turn and finished evenly toward the outside. CHROME HEIR was shut off at the break and dropped well back from early contention, raced outside into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the seven path and passed some rivals widest. STAVANGER was never a factor. CABAR SUL stumbled inward and made contact with Mud Bug leaving the gate then stalked from the seven eighths pole, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Akingisalwaysking
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,chased 3/8,angled 5p turn,even finish toward outside

ENTRY.NAME: Mud Bug
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Heir
ENTRY.COMMENT: shut off break,well back early,outside /12,7p far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 2, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DING DING took the lead nearing the half mile pole and rated the pace, kept the advantage under a hand ride off the rail on the turn, was steadily handled through the stretch and held on well. MO CO GOLD chased the early pace toward mid track, raced close in the three path on the turn and finished well. SCARLET TANAGER gave chase well off the rail through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and finished evenly to take third under the wire. ALWAYS SOMETHING engaged in close chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and was nipped from third the final stride. VALID REASON gave chase toward the outside, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened in the lane. GRANDIOSELY gave chase, rounded the turn in the six path and showed little in the lane. BRUSHING chased outside through the backstretch, race din the six path on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Ding Ding
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 1/2,rated pace,off rail turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DASHING LASS raced off the pace in the five path the opening turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and raced close in the three path on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and got up the final yards. SUPER MONEY stalked two deep then took the nod approaching the five sixteenths pole, drew clear toward the quarter and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn but was caught in the final yards. NELLY TOO was bumped outward and into Gazalani into the first turn then saved ground through the turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and steadily improved from that point, rounded the far turn about the four path and finished well. SK'S HEART settled close off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. PRINCESS MIA ROSE angled in and rated the early pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole but was met approaching the five sixteenths pole, dropped back at the rail approaching the quarter pole and weakened on the far turn. RED RIVER SUSI rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. VIESTE rated close inside on the first turn then faded through the backstretch. LOCKDOWN VANNA raced off the rail into the first turn, left the turn outside and showed little response. GAZALANI was forced outward into the first turn, never factored and was eased. HEY MACARENA drifted outward and into Nelly Too into the first turn, was not a factor and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: Sk's Heart
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Nelly Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped into 1st turn,chased 3/8,4p far turn,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Dashing Lass
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5p 1st turn,bid near 3/8,3p far turn,up final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY BALBOA chased inside through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn then dug in from the head of the lane and got up the final yards. SWIPED THE CASTLE took over while angling to the inside and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn, was steadily handled leaving the turn but was caught flattening stride the final yards. IRISH WIZARD gave chase through the backstretch, raced close in the three path on the turn but flattened the final sixteenth. HARLEY SIOUX became fractious in the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. FUNKLE gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and flattened stride. RESTLESS BUSTER chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened stride. GOLDEN ASSET chased inside, rounded the turn off the rail and weakened in the lane. COURT TUDOR angled out to give early chase, checked off the heels of Restless Buster passing the five sixteenths pole then forced out while losing an iron into the turn. MADMAN JONES chased inside, rough off the heels of Restless Buster and bore out into the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Madman Jones
ENTRY.OWNER: Camp Nancy M and DMC Stable

ENTRY.NAME: My Balboa
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Harley Sioux
ENTRY.OWNER: Straughn William E and Thacker Daniel

ENTRY.NAME: Swiped the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steady urging lane,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Since November 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 2 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNCAPTURED RUBY angled in and rated close to the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and inched clear toward the wire. MIDNIGHT HEIRESS stalked from the four path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. LUCKY BLONDE saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and finished evenly while taking third later yards. SILVER RULES angled to the inside and rated a slim lead, was met leaving the nine sixteenths pole and dueled into the backstretch, cleared Gilded Quest passing the quarter pole, raced at the rail through the far turn but was caught mid-stretch and weakened the final sixteenth. SAVE THE FLAG rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the six path on the far turn and passed rivals in the lane. SOMEBODY LOVES ME saved ground off the pace, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out entering the stretch and showed little more. GIRLS HOUSE raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened in the five path on the far turn. GILDED QUEST angled in and stalked the early pace two deep, drew to even terms at the nine sixteenths pole then dueled leaving the half mile pole, but dropped back past the quarter pole and faded at the rail on the far turn. Per Stewards ruling #4, Uncaptured Ruby is disqualified from earnings.

ENTRY.NAME: Somebody Loves Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Blonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,4p far turn,even finish,along 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Uncaptured Ruby
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,chased 3/8,4p far turn,up 1/16,inched clear late

ENTRY.NAME: Gilded Quest
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Richie Rich Racing Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUPER JORDAN contested a pressured pace and took the nod toward the three eighths pole, edged clear approaching the quarter, drifted leaving the turn but dug in under steady handling and drew away later yards. BRION contested a pressured pace two deep but dropped back toward the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and remained a close factor through the upper stretch before relenting. TAPIO chased outside, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and dug in to take third the final strides. HUEY DUEY pressured the pace three wide down the backstretch, raced close in the three path on the turn but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. SWEET SYNTAX engaged in close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and finished evenly. DANCIN IN DUBAI ducked out at the break causing his rider to lose an iron, recovered past the quarter, raced at the rail on the turn and finished evenly inside. ADIOS SEE YA gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and weakened in the lane. T VILLE gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. VICTORIOUS BEAR gave chase then weakened in the three path on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,lost iron break,recovered past 1/4,even finish inside

ENTRY.NAME: T Ville
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc
